Description: Machbous is a traditional Bahraini rice dish cooked with meat and aromatic spices. It is a flavorful and satisfying main course commonly enjoyed in Bahrain.

Ingredients: 500g meat (lamb, chicken, or beef), cut into pieces
2 tablespoons baharat spice mix (cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, paprika, cumin, coriander)
Instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and saut√© until golden brown.
Add the meat pieces to the pot and cook until browned on all sides.
Stir in the baharat spice mix, turmeric powder, and saffron threads. Cook for a minute to release their flavors.
Add the diced tomatoes and cook until softened.
Pour in the chicken broth and bring the mixture to a boil.
Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Drain well.
Add the rice to the pot, season with salt, and stir well.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the rice is cooked and tender.
Remove from heat and let it rest, covered, for 5 minutes.
Fluff the rice with a fork before serving.
Serve the machbous hot with a side of salad or yogurt.
